Bash Pitfalls
This page is a compilation of common mistakes made by bash users. Each example is flawed in some way. Contents
for f in $(ls *.mp3)
cp $file $target
Filenames with leading dashes
[ $foo = "bar" ]
cd $(dirname "$f")
[ "$foo" = bar && "$bar" = foo ]
[[ $foo > 7 ]]
grep foo bar | while read -r; do ((count++)); done
if [grep foo myfile]
if [bar="$foo"]; then ...
if [ [ a = b ] && [ c = d ] ]; then ...
read $foo
cat file | sed s/foo/bar...

links.title: TOPS-20 Commands Reference Manual
links.description:
A complete TOPS-20 command consists of the command name and usually one
or more arguments.  In the most general sense, arguments are any
combinations of letters, numerals, punctuation marks and other characters
that you type after the command name itself to complete the meaning of the
command.  These arguments can be file specifications, switches,
subcommands, and values for switches and subcommands, as well as words and
numbers (the arguments to...

links.title: Origins and Development of TOPS-20
links.description:
Hence, to understand the factors which influenced the design of TOPS-20, we
have to look back to the late 1960s and the environment in which TENEX was
created.  Some of the ideas that went into TENEX, and the process which
ultimately brought it into DEC, had roots going back to the early 1960's. 
In this section, we will trace these aspects of TOPS-20's history.

classes for each training outlier class and jointly performs a coarse

I'm extremely enthusiastic about learning and experimenting with new technologies and frameworks around web and mobile app development. My interests include hackathons, game jams, motorcycling, camping, and hiking.

links.title: Fine-Grained Sandboxing with V8 Isolates
links.description: Kenton Varda explains how Cloudflare built a compute platform using V8 isolates instead of containers or VMs, achieving 10x-100x faster cold starts and lower memory footprints. He goes through technical details of embedding V8, distributing code, scheduling isolates, resource management, and security risks.

links.title: 📖 Software and Copyright: It’s Complicated
links.description: Intellectual property (IP) concepts play a huge role in software in general and free and open source software in particular. IP is a complex and nuanced body of law, but thankfully you don’t need to pass the bar to understand the fundamental concepts, starting with copyright and its relation to software.

links.title: Owning Your Own Copyrights in Open Source | James Bottomley's random Pages
links.description: This article covers several aspects: owning the copyrights you develop outside of your employed time and the more thorny aspect of owning the copyrights in open source projects you work on for your employer.  It will also take a look at the middle ground of being a contract entity doing paid work on open source.  This article follows the historical sweep of my journey through this field and so some aspects may be outdated and all are within the b...
